Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import urllib.parse import re print("Implementing web scraping approach to identify Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession") print("Focus: Chinese political appointments and succession patterns") print("=" * 100) # Headers to mimic a real browser - MOVED BEFORE FUNCTION DEFINITION headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Define search terms for Chinese government and political information search_terms = [ 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor', 'Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÊîøÊ≤ª‰ªªÂëΩ', # Yangjiang Zhongshan political appointments 'Guangdong officials Yangjiang Zhongshan succession', 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ Ë∞É‰ªª ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary transferred to Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang to Zhongshan political career path' ] # Function to search using Bing search engine def search_web(query, max_results=8): results = [] try: # Use Bing search (more accessible than Google) bing_url = f"https://www.bing.com/search?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" print(f"\nSearching Bing for: {query}") print(f"URL: {bing_url}") response = requests.get(bing_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Find search result elements in Bing search_results = soup.find_all('li', class_='b_algo') if not search_results: # Try alternative selectors search_results = soup.find_all('div', class_='b_algo') print(f"Found {len(search_results)} Bing search results") for i, result in enumerate(search_results[:max_results]): try: # Extract title title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('h3') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = title_elem.find('a') if title_elem else result.find('a') link = link_elem.get('href', 'No link') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet snippet_elem = result.find('p') or result.find('div', class_='b_caption') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f"\nResult {i+1}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Analyze for political succession indicators combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" # Key indicators for analysis yangjiang_indicators = ['yangjiang', 'Èò≥Ê±ü', 'party secretary', 'Â∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞', '‰π¶ËÆ∞'] zhongshan_indicators = ['zhongshan', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'municipal'] succession_indicators = ['appointment', 'succession', 'career', 'promoted', 'transferred', 'became', 'appointed', '‰ªªÂëΩ', 'Âçá‰ªª', 'Ë∞É‰ªª', 'Êé•‰ªª'] has_yangjiang = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in yangjiang_indicators) has_zhongshan = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in zhongshan_indicators) has_succession = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in succession_indicators) relevance_score = sum([has_yangjiang, has_zhongshan, has_succession]) # Display analysis results if has_yangjiang: print("‚úì Contains Yangjiang references") if has_zhongshan: print("‚úì Contains Zhongshan references") if has_succession: print("‚úì Contains succession/appointment indicators") if relevance_score >= 2: print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT RESULT (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") elif relevance_score >= 1: print(f"‚≠ê POTENTIALLY RELEVANT (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") else: print(f"üìã LOW RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") # Store result with analysis results.append({ 'source': 'Bing', 'query': query, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'has_yangjiang': has_yangjiang, 'has_zhongshan': has_zhongshan, 'has_succession': has_succession, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) print("-" * 50) except Exception as e: print(f"Error processing result {i+1}: {str(e)}") continue else: print(f"Failed to access Bing search: HTTP {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 429: print("Rate limited by Bing. Adding longer delay...") time.sleep(10) except Exception as e: print(f"Error during Bing search: {str(e)}") return results # Perform searches with different terms all_search_results = [] for i, term in enumerate(search_terms, 1): print(f"\n{'='*100}") print(f"SEARCH {i}/{len(search_terms)}: {term}") print(f"{'='*100}") search_results = search_web(term, max_results=6) all_search_results.extend(search_results) print(f"\nCollected {len(search_results)} results for this search term") print(f"Total results so far: {len(all_search_results)}") # Add delay between searches to avoid rate limiting if i < len(search_terms): print("Waiting 3 seconds before next search...") time.sleep(3) # Comprehensive analysis of all collected results print(f"\n\n{'='*100}") print("COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL SEARCH RESULTS") print(f"{'='*100}") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") # Filter and categorize results by relevance high_relevance = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 2] medium_relevance = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] == 1] both_cities = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_yangjiang'] and r['has_zhongshan']] with_succession = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_succession']] print(f"High relevance results (‚â•2 criteria): {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Medium relevance results (1 criterion): {len(medium_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results with succession indicators: {len(with_succession)}") # Display most relevant results if high_relevance: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS:") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f"\n[{i}] Query: {result['query']}") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Relevance Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3") print(f"Analysis: Yangjiang({result['has_yangjiang']}), Zhongshan({result['has_zhongshan']}), Succession({result['has_succession']})") print("-" * 70) if both_cities: print(f"\nüèõÔ∏è RESULTS MENTIONING BOTH YANGJIANG AND ZHONGSHAN:") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(both_cities, 1): print(f"\n[{i}] Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Relevance Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3") print("-" * 70) # Extract potential names and political information print(f"\n\nüîç EXTRACTING POLITICAL APPOINTMENT INFORMATION:") print(f"{'='*70}") all_potential_names = set() all_potential_years = set() all_political_terms = set() relevant_results = high_relevance if high_relevance else (both_cities if both_cities else all_search_results[:5]) for i, result in enumerate(relevant_results, 1): print(f"\n[Analysis {i}] Processing: {result['title']}") # Combine title and snippet for analysis text_to_analyze = f"{result['title']} {result['snippet']}" # Pattern for Chinese names (2-4 Chinese characters) chinese_name_pattern = r'[\u4e00-\u9fff]{2,4}(?=[^\u4e00-\u9fff]|$)' potential_names = re.findall(chinese_name_pattern, text_to_analyze) # Pattern for years (appointment dates) year_pattern = r'(19|20)\d{2}' potential_years = re.findall(year_pattern, text_to_analyze) # Look for specific political terms political_terms = ['secretary', '‰π¶ËÆ∞', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'appointed', '‰ªªÂëΩ', 'promoted', 'Âçá‰ªª', 'transferred', 'Ë∞É‰ªª', 'succeeded', 'Êé•‰ªª'] found_terms = [term for term in political_terms if term in text_to_analyze.lower()] if potential_names: filtered_names = [name for name in potential_names if len(name) >= 2 and name not in ['Èò≥Ê±ü', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'Âπø‰∏ú', 'Â∏ÇÂßî', 'ÊîøÂ∫ú']] if filtered_names: print(f"Potential names found: {', '.join(set(filtered_names))}") all_potential_names.update(filtered_names) if potential_years: print(f"Potential appointment years: {', '.join(set(potential_years))}") all_potential_years.update(potential_years) if found_terms: print(f"Political terms found: {', '.join(found_terms)}") all_political_terms.update(found_terms) print(f"Text preview: {text_to_analyze[:250]}...") print("-" * 50) # Save comprehensive results to workspace results_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Web scraping with requests and BeautifulSoup (Bing search)', 'search_objective': 'Identify Party Secretaries of Yangjiang Province who later became Mayor of Zhongshan', 'search_terms': search_terms, 'total_results': len(all_search_results), 'high_relevance_count': len(high_relevance), 'medium_relevance_count': len(medium_relevance), 'both_cities_count': len(both_cities), 'succession_indicators_count': len(with_succession), 'extracted_data': { 'potential_names': list(all_potential_names), 'potential_years': list(all_potential_years), 'political_terms': list(all_political_terms) }, 'all_results': all_search_results, 'high_relevance_results': high_relevance, 'both_cities_results': both_cities, 'succession_results': with_succession } results_file = 'workspace/yangjiang_zhongshan_webscraping_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(results_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä FINAL SEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"{'='*50}") print(f"Search method: Web scraping (Bing search engine)") print(f"Total search terms used: {len(search_terms)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") print(f"High relevance results: {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results with succession indicators: {len(with_succession)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if all_potential_names: print(f"\nüë• EXTRACTED POTENTIAL NAMES: {', '.join(sorted(all_potential_names))}") if all_potential_years: print(f"üìÖ EXTRACTED POTENTIAL YEARS: {', '.join(sorted(all_potential_years))}") if all_political_terms: print(f"üèõÔ∏è POLITICAL TERMS FOUND: {', '.join(sorted(all_political_terms))}") print(f"\nüèÅ WEB SCRAPING SEARCH COMPLETE!") print(f"Next step: Analyze the collected results to identify specific officials and their career trajectories.") print(f"If no clear succession pattern is found, may need to try alternative search approaches or sources.")

tester
2025-08-07 06:50:43
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code crashed with 'NameError: name headers is not defined' during all search attempts. The error occurred because the 'headers' variable was referenced in the requests.get() call within the search_web() function, but the headers dictionary was defined after the function definition in the code, making it inaccessible due to Python's variable scoping rules. This prevented all 6 search attempts from executing successfully, resulting in 0 search results collected. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no political succession information obtained due to the variable scope error. The web scraping approach and comprehensive search strategy are well-designed with good Chinese/English term combinations, but the technical implementation has a critical scoping issue. Recommended fix: Move the 'headers' dictionary definition to before the search_web() function definition (around line 8-15) so it's accessible within the function scope. Once this is resolved, the code should be able to perform the intended searches for Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession patterns.
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import urllib.parse import re print("Implementing web scraping approach to identify Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession") print("Focus: Chinese political appointments and succession patterns") print("=" * 100) # Headers to mimic a real browser - MOVED BEFORE FUNCTION DEFINITION headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Define search terms for Chinese government and political information search_terms = [ 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor', 'Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÊîøÊ≤ª‰ªªÂëΩ', # Yangjiang Zhongshan political appointments 'Guangdong officials Yangjiang Zhongshan succession', 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ Ë∞É‰ªª ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary transferred to Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang to Zhongshan political career path' ] # Function to search using Bing search engine def search_web(query, max_results=8): results = [] try: # Use Bing search (more accessible than Google) bing_url = f"https://www.bing.com/search?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" print(f"\nSearching Bing for: {query}") print(f"URL: {bing_url}") response = requests.get(bing_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Find search result elements in Bing search_results = soup.find_all('li', class_='b_algo') if not search_results: # Try alternative selectors search_results = soup.find_all('div', class_='b_algo') print(f"Found {len(search_results)} Bing search results") for i, result in enumerate(search_results[:max_results]): try: # Extract title title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('h3') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = title_elem.find('a') if title_elem else result.find('a') link = link_elem.get('href', 'No link') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet snippet_elem = result.find('p') or result.find('div', class_='b_caption') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f"\nResult {i+1}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Analyze for political succession indicators combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" # Key indicators for analysis yangjiang_indicators = ['yangjiang', 'Èò≥Ê±ü', 'party secretary', 'Â∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞', '‰π¶ËÆ∞'] zhongshan_indicators = ['zhongshan', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'municipal'] succession_indicators = ['appointment', 'succession', 'career', 'promoted', 'transferred', 'became', 'appointed', '‰ªªÂëΩ', 'Âçá‰ªª', 'Ë∞É‰ªª', 'Êé•‰ªª'] has_yangjiang = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in yangjiang_indicators) has_zhongshan = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in zhongshan_indicators) has_succession = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in succession_indicators) relevance_score = sum([has_yangjiang, has_zhongshan, has_succession]) # Display analysis results if has_yangjiang: print("‚úì Contains Yangjiang references") if has_zhongshan: print("‚úì Contains Zhongshan references") if has_succession: print("‚úì Contains succession/appointment indicators") if relevance_score >= 2: print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT RESULT (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") elif relevance_score >= 1: print(f"‚≠ê POTENTIALLY RELEVANT (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") else: print(f"üìã LOW RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") # Store result with analysis results.append({ 'source': 'Bing', 'query': query, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'has_yangjiang': has_yangjiang, 'has_zhongshan': has_zhongshan, 'has_succession': has_succession, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) print("-" * 50) except Exception as e: print(f"Error processing result {i+1}: {str(e)}") continue else: print(f"Failed to access Bing search: HTTP {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 429: print("Rate limited by Bing. Adding longer delay...") time.sleep(10) except Exception as e: print(f"Error during Bing search: {str(e)}") return results # Perform searches with different terms all_search_results = [] for i, term in enumerate(search_terms, 1): print(f"\n{'='*100}") print(f"SEARCH {i}/{len(search_terms)}: {term}") print(f"{'='*100}") search_results = search_web(term, max_results=6) all_search_results.extend(search_results) print(f"\nCollected {len(search_results)} results for this search term") print(f"Total results so far: {len(all_search_results)}") # Add delay between searches to avoid rate limiting if i < len(search_terms): print("Waiting 3 seconds before next search...") time.sleep(3) # Comprehensive analysis of all collected results print(f"\n\n{'='*100}") print("COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL SEARCH RESULTS") print(f"{'='*100}") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") # Filter and categorize results by relevance high_relevance = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 2] medium_relevance = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] == 1] both_cities = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_yangjiang'] and r['has_zhongshan']] with_succession = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_succession']] print(f"High relevance results (‚â•2 criteria): {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Medium relevance results (1 criterion): {len(medium_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results with succession indicators: {len(with_succession)}") # Display most relevant results if high_relevance: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS:") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f"\n[{i}] Query: {result['query']}") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Relevance Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3") print(f"Analysis: Yangjiang({result['has_yangjiang']}), Zhongshan({result['has_zhongshan']}), Succession({result['has_succession']})") print("-" * 70) if both_cities: print(f"\nüèõÔ∏è RESULTS MENTIONING BOTH YANGJIANG AND ZHONGSHAN:") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(both_cities, 1): print(f"\n[{i}] Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Relevance Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3") print("-" * 70) # Extract potential names and political information print(f"\n\nüîç EXTRACTING POLITICAL APPOINTMENT INFORMATION:") print(f"{'='*70}") all_potential_names = set() all_potential_years = set() all_political_terms = set() relevant_results = high_relevance if high_relevance else (both_cities if both_cities else all_search_results[:5]) for i, result in enumerate(relevant_results, 1): print(f"\n[Analysis {i}] Processing: {result['title']}") # Combine title and snippet for analysis text_to_analyze = f"{result['title']} {result['snippet']}" # Pattern for Chinese names (2-4 Chinese characters) chinese_name_pattern = r'[\u4e00-\u9fff]{2,4}(?=[^\u4e00-\u9fff]|$)' potential_names = re.findall(chinese_name_pattern, text_to_analyze) # Pattern for years (appointment dates) year_pattern = r'(19|20)\d{2}' potential_years = re.findall(year_pattern, text_to_analyze) # Look for specific political terms political_terms = ['secretary', '‰π¶ËÆ∞', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'appointed', '‰ªªÂëΩ', 'promoted', 'Âçá‰ªª', 'transferred', 'Ë∞É‰ªª', 'succeeded', 'Êé•‰ªª'] found_terms = [term for term in political_terms if term in text_to_analyze.lower()] if potential_names: filtered_names = [name for name in potential_names if len(name) >= 2 and name not in ['Èò≥Ê±ü', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'Âπø‰∏ú', 'Â∏ÇÂßî', 'ÊîøÂ∫ú']] if filtered_names: print(f"Potential names found: {', '.join(set(filtered_names))}") all_potential_names.update(filtered_names) if potential_years: print(f"Potential appointment years: {', '.join(set(potential_years))}") all_potential_years.update(potential_years) if found_terms: print(f"Political terms found: {', '.join(found_terms)}") all_political_terms.update(found_terms) print(f"Text preview: {text_to_analyze[:250]}...") print("-" * 50) # Save comprehensive results to workspace results_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Web scraping with requests and BeautifulSoup (Bing search)', 'search_objective': 'Identify Party Secretaries of Yangjiang Province who later became Mayor of Zhongshan', 'search_terms': search_terms, 'total_results': len(all_search_results), 'high_relevance_count': len(high_relevance), 'medium_relevance_count': len(medium_relevance), 'both_cities_count': len(both_cities), 'succession_indicators_count': len(with_succession), 'extracted_data': { 'potential_names': list(all_potential_names), 'potential_years': list(all_potential_years), 'political_terms': list(all_political_terms) }, 'all_results': all_search_results, 'high_relevance_results': high_relevance, 'both_cities_results': both_cities, 'succession_results': with_succession } results_file = 'workspace/yangjiang_zhongshan_webscraping_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(results_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä FINAL SEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"{'='*50}") print(f"Search method: Web scraping (Bing search engine)") print(f"Total search terms used: {len(search_terms)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") print(f"High relevance results: {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results with succession indicators: {len(with_succession)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if all_potential_names: print(f"\nüë• EXTRACTED POTENTIAL NAMES: {', '.join(sorted(all_potential_names))}") if all_potential_years: print(f"üìÖ EXTRACTED POTENTIAL YEARS: {', '.join(sorted(all_potential_years))}") if all_political_terms: print(f"üèõÔ∏è POLITICAL TERMS FOUND: {', '.join(sorted(all_political_terms))}") print(f"\nüèÅ WEB SCRAPING SEARCH COMPLETE!") print(f"Next step: Analyze the collected results to identify specific officials and their career trajectories.") print(f"If no clear succession pattern is found, may need to try alternative search approaches or sources.")

2025-08-07 06:53:03
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 4)

Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import urllib.parse import re print("Implementing corrected web scraping approach to identify Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession") print("Focus: Chinese political appointments and succession patterns") print("=" * 100) # Headers to mimic a real browser - DEFINED FIRST TO AVOID SCOPING ISSUES headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print("Headers defined successfully for web scraping") # Define comprehensive search terms for Chinese government and political information search_terms = [ 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor', 'Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÊîøÊ≤ª‰ªªÂëΩ', # Yangjiang Zhongshan political appointments 'Guangdong officials Yangjiang Zhongshan succession', 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ Ë∞É‰ªª ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary transferred to Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang to Zhongshan political career path', 'Âπø‰∏úÁúÅ Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÂÆòÂëòË∞ÉÂä®', # Guangdong Province Yangjiang Zhongshan official transfers 'Chinese Communist Party Yangjiang Zhongshan appointments' ] print(f"Prepared {len(search_terms)} search terms for comprehensive analysis") # Function to search using Bing search engine with proper error handling def search_web(query, max_results=6): results = [] print(f"\nExecuting search for: {query}") try: # Use Bing search (more accessible than Google) bing_url = f"https://www.bing.com/search?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" print(f"Bing URL: {bing_url}") response = requests.get(bing_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Find search result elements in Bing with multiple selectors search_results = soup.find_all('li', class_='b_algo') if not search_results: search_results = soup.find_all('div', class_='b_algo') if not search_results: # Try more generic selectors search_results = soup.find_all('div', {'class': lambda x: x and 'algo' in x}) print(f"Found {len(search_results)} search results") for i, result in enumerate(search_results[:max_results]): try: # Extract title with multiple approaches title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('h3') or result.find('a') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = title_elem.find('a') if title_elem and title_elem.name != 'a' else title_elem link = link_elem.get('href', 'No link') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet snippet_elem = result.find('p') or result.find('div', class_='b_caption') or result.find('span') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f"\nResult {i+1}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Analyze for political succession indicators combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" # Key indicators for comprehensive analysis yangjiang_indicators = ['yangjiang', 'Èò≥Ê±ü', 'party secretary', 'Â∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞', '‰π¶ËÆ∞', 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏Ç'] zhongshan_indicators = ['zhongshan', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'municipal', '‰∏≠Â±±Â∏Ç'] succession_indicators = [ 'appointment', 'succession', 'career', 'promoted', 'transferred', 'became', 'appointed', '‰ªªÂëΩ', 'Âçá‰ªª', 'Ë∞É‰ªª', 'Êé•‰ªª', 'ÊãÖ‰ªª', 'Âá∫‰ªª', 'Â∞±‰ªª' ] has_yangjiang = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in yangjiang_indicators) has_zhongshan = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in zhongshan_indicators) has_succession = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in succession_indicators) relevance_score = sum([has_yangjiang, has_zhongshan, has_succession]) # Display detailed analysis results if has_yangjiang: print("‚úì Contains Yangjiang references") if has_zhongshan: print("‚úì Contains Zhongshan references") if has_succession: print("‚úì Contains succession/appointment indicators") if relevance_score >= 2: print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT RESULT (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") elif relevance_score >= 1: print(f"‚≠ê POTENTIALLY RELEVANT (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") else: print(f"üìã LOW RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") # Store result with comprehensive analysis results.append({ 'source': 'Bing', 'query': query, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'has_yangjiang': has_yangjiang, 'has_zhongshan': has_zhongshan, 'has_succession': has_succession, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'combined_text': combined_text }) print("-" * 50) except Exception as e: print(f"Error processing result {i+1}: {str(e)}") continue elif response.status_code == 429: print("Rate limited by Bing. Adding extended delay...") time.sleep(15) else: print(f"Failed to access Bing search: HTTP {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error during Bing search: {str(e)}") print(f"Completed search for '{query}': {len(results)} results collected") return results # Execute comprehensive search campaign all_search_results = [] total_searches = len(search_terms) print(f"\nStarting comprehensive search campaign with {total_searches} different search strategies...") print("=" * 100) for i, term in enumerate(search_terms, 1): print(f"\n{'='*100}") print(f"SEARCH {i}/{total_searches}: {term}") print(f"{'='*100}") search_results = search_web(term, max_results=5) all_search_results.extend(search_results) print(f"\nüìä Search {i} Summary:") print(f"Results collected: {len(search_results)}") print(f"Cumulative total: {len(all_search_results)}") # Add progressive delay between searches to avoid rate limiting if i < total_searches: delay_time = 4 + (i * 0.5) # Increasing delay print(f"Waiting {delay_time:.1f} seconds before next search...") time.sleep(delay_time) # Comprehensive analysis and categorization of all results print(f"\n\n{'='*100}") print("COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL SEARCH RESULTS") print(f"{'='*100}") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") # Advanced filtering and categorization high_relevance = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 2] medium_relevance = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] == 1] both_cities = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_yangjiang'] and r['has_zhongshan']] with_succession = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_succession']] perfect_match = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] == 3] print(f"\nüìà RESULT CATEGORIZATION:") print(f"Perfect matches (all 3 criteria): {len(perfect_match)}") print(f"High relevance (‚â•2 criteria): {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Medium relevance (1 criterion): {len(medium_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results with succession indicators: {len(with_succession)}") # Display perfect matches first if perfect_match: print(f"\nüèÜ PERFECT MATCHES (ALL 3 CRITERIA):") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(perfect_match, 1): print(f"\n[PERFECT {i}] Query: {result['query']}") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3 (Yangjiang: {result['has_yangjiang']}, Zhongshan: {result['has_zhongshan']}, Succession: {result['has_succession']})") print("-" * 70) # Display high relevance results if high_relevance: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS:") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f"\n[HIGH {i}] Query: {result['query']}") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3 (Yangjiang: {result['has_yangjiang']}, Zhongshan: {result['has_zhongshan']}, Succession: {result['has_succession']})") print("-" * 70) # Display results mentioning both cities if both_cities: print(f"\nüèõÔ∏è RESULTS MENTIONING BOTH YANGJIANG AND ZHONGSHAN:") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(both_cities, 1): print(f"\n[BOTH {i}] Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3") print("-" * 70) # Advanced name and information extraction print(f"\n\nüîç ADVANCED POLITICAL INFORMATION EXTRACTION:") print(f"{'='*70}") all_potential_names = set() all_potential_years = set() all_political_terms = set() all_key_phrases = set() # Use the most relevant results for extraction relevant_results = perfect_match if perfect_match else (high_relevance if high_relevance else (both_cities if both_cities else all_search_results[:8])) for i, result in enumerate(relevant_results, 1): print(f"\n[EXTRACTION {i}] Analyzing: {result['title']}") # Combine all text for comprehensive analysis text_to_analyze = f"{result['title']} {result['snippet']}" # Enhanced pattern for Chinese names (2-4 characters, avoiding place names) chinese_name_pattern = r'[\u4e00-\u9fff]{2,4}(?=[^\u4e00-\u9fff]|$)' potential_names = re.findall(chinese_name_pattern, text_to_analyze) # Pattern for years (appointment dates) year_pattern = r'(19|20)\d{2}' potential_years = re.findall(year_pattern, text_to_analyze) # Enhanced political terms detection political_terms = [ 'secretary', '‰π¶ËÆ∞', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'appointed', '‰ªªÂëΩ', 'promoted', 'Âçá‰ªª', 'transferred', 'Ë∞É‰ªª', 'succeeded', 'Êé•‰ªª', 'chairman', '‰∏ªÂ∏≠', 'director', '‰∏ª‰ªª', 'governor', 'ÁúÅÈïø', 'deputy', 'ÂâØ', 'acting', '‰ª£ÁêÜ', 'interim', '‰∏¥Êó∂' ] found_terms = [term for term in political_terms if term in text_to_analyze.lower()] # Extract key phrases related to political succession succession_phrases = re.findall(r'[\u4e00-\u9fff\w\s]{10,50}(?:‰ªªÂëΩ|Âçá‰ªª|Ë∞É‰ªª|Êé•‰ªª|ÊãÖ‰ªª|Âá∫‰ªª)[\u4e00-\u9fff\w\s]{10,50}', text_to_analyze) # Filter and display findings if potential_names: # Filter out common place names and administrative terms excluded_terms = {'Èò≥Ê±ü', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'Âπø‰∏ú', 'Â∏ÇÂßî', 'ÊîøÂ∫ú', '‰∫∫Ê∞ë', '‰∏≠ÂõΩ', 'ÂÖ±‰∫ßÂÖö', 'ÂßîÂëò‰ºö', '‰∫∫Â§ß', 'ÊîøÂçè'} filtered_names = [name for name in potential_names if len(name) >= 2 and name not in excluded_terms] if filtered_names: unique_names = list(set(filtered_names)) print(f"Potential official names: {', '.join(unique_names)}") all_potential_names.update(unique_names) if potential_years: unique_years = list(set(potential_years)) print(f"Potential appointment years: {', '.join(unique_years)}") all_potential_years.update(unique_years) if found_terms: unique_terms = list(set(found_terms)) print(f"Political terms found: {', '.join(unique_terms)}") all_political_terms.update(unique_terms) if succession_phrases: print(f"Succession phrases: {'; '.join(succession_phrases[:2])}") all_key_phrases.update(succession_phrases) print(f"Text preview: {text_to_analyze[:250]}...") print("-" * 50) # Save comprehensive results to workspace results_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Web scraping with requests and BeautifulSoup (Bing search) - Fixed version', 'search_objective': 'Identify Party Secretaries of Yangjiang Province who later became Mayor of Zhongshan', 'search_terms': search_terms, 'total_searches_conducted': len(search_terms), 'total_results': len(all_search_results), 'result_categorization': { 'perfect_matches': len(perfect_match), 'high_relevance_count': len(high_relevance), 'medium_relevance_count': len(medium_relevance), 'both_cities_count': len(both_cities), 'succession_indicators_count': len(with_succession) }, 'extracted_intelligence': { 'potential_names': list(all_potential_names), 'potential_years': list(all_potential_years), 'political_terms': list(all_political_terms), 'key_phrases': list(all_key_phrases) }, 'all_results': all_search_results, 'perfect_matches': perfect_match, 'high_relevance_results': high_relevance, 'both_cities_results': both_cities, 'succession_results': with_succession } results_file = 'workspace/yangjiang_zhongshan_political_succession_comprehensive.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(results_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH CAMPAIGN SUMMARY:") print(f"{'='*60}") print(f"Search method: Web scraping (Bing search engine) - FIXED") print(f"Total search terms executed: {len(search_terms)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") print(f"Perfect matches (all 3 criteria): {len(perfect_match)}") print(f"High relevance results (‚â•2 criteria): {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results with succession indicators: {len(with_succession)}") print(f"Comprehensive results saved to: {results_file}") # Display extracted intelligence summary if all_potential_names: print(f"\nüë• EXTRACTED POTENTIAL OFFICIAL NAMES: {', '.join(sorted(all_potential_names))}") if all_potential_years: print(f"üìÖ EXTRACTED POTENTIAL APPOINTMENT YEARS: {', '.join(sorted(all_potential_years))}") if all_political_terms: print(f"üèõÔ∏è POLITICAL TERMS IDENTIFIED: {', '.join(sorted(all_political_terms))}") print(f"\nüèÅ COMPREHENSIVE WEB SCRAPING SEARCH COMPLETE!") print(f"Status: Successfully executed all {len(search_terms)} search strategies") print(f"Next step: Analyze the {len(all_search_results)} collected results to identify specific succession patterns") print(f"Focus: Look for officials who moved from Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor positions") if len(all_search_results) == 0: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: No search results obtained. This could indicate:") print(f" 1. Network connectivity issues") print(f" 2. Search engine blocking/rate limiting") print(f" 3. Need for alternative search approaches") print(f" 4. Very specific/rare political succession pattern") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Collected {len(all_search_results)} results for analysis") print(f" Ready for detailed examination of political succession patterns")

databases and museum collections 3. üìö Contact Suffolk historical societies directly 4. üîç Try alternative search strategies or academic databases 5. üìã Review all saved HTML files for Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code crashed with 'NameError: name headers is not defined' during all search attempts, despite the comment claiming the headers were 'MOVED BEFORE FUNCTION DEFINITION'. Looking at the code structure, the headers dictionary is actually defined AFTER the print statements but BEFORE the search_web() function, which should make it accessible. However, the error persists across all 6 searches, indicating a deeper scoping issue or the headers variable is somehow not in scope when the function executes. The output also shows mixed content from other unrelated tasks (Edith Garrud, Sylvia Pankhurst Suffolk research, Wayback Machine checks), suggesting there may be execution environment issues or code contamination. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no search results obtained, preventing identification of the Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession chain. Recommended fix: (1) Ensure headers is defined as a global variable or passed as a function parameter, (2) Add a simple print statement to verify headers is accessible before the function call, (3) Consider simplifying the approach by defining headers directly within the search_web() function to eliminate scoping issues entirely.
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import urllib.parse import re print("Implementing corrected web scraping approach to identify Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession") print("Focus: Chinese political appointments and succession patterns") print("=" * 100) # Headers to mimic a real browser - DEFINED FIRST TO AVOID SCOPING ISSUES headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } print("Headers defined successfully for web scraping") # Define comprehensive search terms for Chinese government and political information search_terms = [ 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor', 'Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÊîøÊ≤ª‰ªªÂëΩ', # Yangjiang Zhongshan political appointments 'Guangdong officials Yangjiang Zhongshan succession', 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ Ë∞É‰ªª ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary transferred to Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang to Zhongshan political career path', 'Âπø‰∏úÁúÅ Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÂÆòÂëòË∞ÉÂä®', # Guangdong Province Yangjiang Zhongshan official transfers 'Chinese Communist Party Yangjiang Zhongshan appointments' ] print(f"Prepared {len(search_terms)} search terms for comprehensive analysis") # Function to search using Bing search engine with proper error handling def search_web(query, max_results=6): results = [] print(f"\nExecuting search for: {query}") try: # Use Bing search (more accessible than Google) bing_url = f"https://www.bing.com/search?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" print(f"Bing URL: {bing_url}") response = requests.get(bing_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Find search result elements in Bing with multiple selectors search_results = soup.find_all('li', class_='b_algo') if not search_results: search_results = soup.find_all('div', class_='b_algo') if not search_results: # Try more generic selectors search_results = soup.find_all('div', {'class': lambda x: x and 'algo' in x}) print(f"Found {len(search_results)} search results") for i, result in enumerate(search_results[:max_results]): try: # Extract title with multiple approaches title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('h3') or result.find('a') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = title_elem.find('a') if title_elem and title_elem.name != 'a' else title_elem link = link_elem.get('href', 'No link') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet snippet_elem = result.find('p') or result.find('div', class_='b_caption') or result.find('span') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f"\nResult {i+1}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:200]}..." if len(snippet) > 200 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Analyze for political succession indicators combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" # Key indicators for comprehensive analysis yangjiang_indicators = ['yangjiang', 'Èò≥Ê±ü', 'party secretary', 'Â∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞', '‰π¶ËÆ∞', 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏Ç'] zhongshan_indicators = ['zhongshan', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'municipal', '‰∏≠Â±±Â∏Ç'] succession_indicators = [ 'appointment', 'succession', 'career', 'promoted', 'transferred', 'became', 'appointed', '‰ªªÂëΩ', 'Âçá‰ªª', 'Ë∞É‰ªª', 'Êé•‰ªª', 'ÊãÖ‰ªª', 'Âá∫‰ªª', 'Â∞±‰ªª' ] has_yangjiang = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in yangjiang_indicators) has_zhongshan = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in zhongshan_indicators) has_succession = any(indicator in combined_text for indicator in succession_indicators) relevance_score = sum([has_yangjiang, has_zhongshan, has_succession]) # Display detailed analysis results if has_yangjiang: print("‚úì Contains Yangjiang references") if has_zhongshan: print("‚úì Contains Zhongshan references") if has_succession: print("‚úì Contains succession/appointment indicators") if relevance_score >= 2: print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT RESULT (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") elif relevance_score >= 1: print(f"‚≠ê POTENTIALLY RELEVANT (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") else: print(f"üìã LOW RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/3)") # Store result with comprehensive analysis results.append({ 'source': 'Bing', 'query': query, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'has_yangjiang': has_yangjiang, 'has_zhongshan': has_zhongshan, 'has_succession': has_succession, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'combined_text': combined_text }) print("-" * 50) except Exception as e: print(f"Error processing result {i+1}: {str(e)}") continue elif response.status_code == 429: print("Rate limited by Bing. Adding extended delay...") time.sleep(15) else: print(f"Failed to access Bing search: HTTP {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error during Bing search: {str(e)}") print(f"Completed search for '{query}': {len(results)} results collected") return results # Execute comprehensive search campaign all_search_results = [] total_searches = len(search_terms) print(f"\nStarting comprehensive search campaign with {total_searches} different search strategies...") print("=" * 100) for i, term in enumerate(search_terms, 1): print(f"\n{'='*100}") print(f"SEARCH {i}/{total_searches}: {term}") print(f"{'='*100}") search_results = search_web(term, max_results=5) all_search_results.extend(search_results) print(f"\nüìä Search {i} Summary:") print(f"Results collected: {len(search_results)}") print(f"Cumulative total: {len(all_search_results)}") # Add progressive delay between searches to avoid rate limiting if i < total_searches: delay_time = 4 + (i * 0.5) # Increasing delay print(f"Waiting {delay_time:.1f} seconds before next search...") time.sleep(delay_time) # Comprehensive analysis and categorization of all results print(f"\n\n{'='*100}") print("COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL SEARCH RESULTS") print(f"{'='*100}") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") # Advanced filtering and categorization high_relevance = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 2] medium_relevance = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] == 1] both_cities = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_yangjiang'] and r['has_zhongshan']] with_succession = [r for r in all_search_results if r['has_succession']] perfect_match = [r for r in all_search_results if r['relevance_score'] == 3] print(f"\nüìà RESULT CATEGORIZATION:") print(f"Perfect matches (all 3 criteria): {len(perfect_match)}") print(f"High relevance (‚â•2 criteria): {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Medium relevance (1 criterion): {len(medium_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results with succession indicators: {len(with_succession)}") # Display perfect matches first if perfect_match: print(f"\nüèÜ PERFECT MATCHES (ALL 3 CRITERIA):") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(perfect_match, 1): print(f"\n[PERFECT {i}] Query: {result['query']}") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3 (Yangjiang: {result['has_yangjiang']}, Zhongshan: {result['has_zhongshan']}, Succession: {result['has_succession']})") print("-" * 70) # Display high relevance results if high_relevance: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS:") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f"\n[HIGH {i}] Query: {result['query']}") print(f"Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3 (Yangjiang: {result['has_yangjiang']}, Zhongshan: {result['has_zhongshan']}, Succession: {result['has_succession']})") print("-" * 70) # Display results mentioning both cities if both_cities: print(f"\nüèõÔ∏è RESULTS MENTIONING BOTH YANGJIANG AND ZHONGSHAN:") print(f"{'='*70}") for i, result in enumerate(both_cities, 1): print(f"\n[BOTH {i}] Title: {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:300]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 300 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Score: {result['relevance_score']}/3") print("-" * 70) # Advanced name and information extraction print(f"\n\nüîç ADVANCED POLITICAL INFORMATION EXTRACTION:") print(f"{'='*70}") all_potential_names = set() all_potential_years = set() all_political_terms = set() all_key_phrases = set() # Use the most relevant results for extraction relevant_results = perfect_match if perfect_match else (high_relevance if high_relevance else (both_cities if both_cities else all_search_results[:8])) for i, result in enumerate(relevant_results, 1): print(f"\n[EXTRACTION {i}] Analyzing: {result['title']}") # Combine all text for comprehensive analysis text_to_analyze = f"{result['title']} {result['snippet']}" # Enhanced pattern for Chinese names (2-4 characters, avoiding place names) chinese_name_pattern = r'[\u4e00-\u9fff]{2,4}(?=[^\u4e00-\u9fff]|$)' potential_names = re.findall(chinese_name_pattern, text_to_analyze) # Pattern for years (appointment dates) year_pattern = r'(19|20)\d{2}' potential_years = re.findall(year_pattern, text_to_analyze) # Enhanced political terms detection political_terms = [ 'secretary', '‰π¶ËÆ∞', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'appointed', '‰ªªÂëΩ', 'promoted', 'Âçá‰ªª', 'transferred', 'Ë∞É‰ªª', 'succeeded', 'Êé•‰ªª', 'chairman', '‰∏ªÂ∏≠', 'director', '‰∏ª‰ªª', 'governor', 'ÁúÅÈïø', 'deputy', 'ÂâØ', 'acting', '‰ª£ÁêÜ', 'interim', '‰∏¥Êó∂' ] found_terms = [term for term in political_terms if term in text_to_analyze.lower()] # Extract key phrases related to political succession succession_phrases = re.findall(r'[\u4e00-\u9fff\w\s]{10,50}(?:‰ªªÂëΩ|Âçá‰ªª|Ë∞É‰ªª|Êé•‰ªª|ÊãÖ‰ªª|Âá∫‰ªª)[\u4e00-\u9fff\w\s]{10,50}', text_to_analyze) # Filter and display findings if potential_names: # Filter out common place names and administrative terms excluded_terms = {'Èò≥Ê±ü', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'Âπø‰∏ú', 'Â∏ÇÂßî', 'ÊîøÂ∫ú', '‰∫∫Ê∞ë', '‰∏≠ÂõΩ', 'ÂÖ±‰∫ßÂÖö', 'ÂßîÂëò‰ºö', '‰∫∫Â§ß', 'ÊîøÂçè'} filtered_names = [name for name in potential_names if len(name) >= 2 and name not in excluded_terms] if filtered_names: unique_names = list(set(filtered_names)) print(f"Potential official names: {', '.join(unique_names)}") all_potential_names.update(unique_names) if potential_years: unique_years = list(set(potential_years)) print(f"Potential appointment years: {', '.join(unique_years)}") all_potential_years.update(unique_years) if found_terms: unique_terms = list(set(found_terms)) print(f"Political terms found: {', '.join(unique_terms)}") all_political_terms.update(unique_terms) if succession_phrases: print(f"Succession phrases: {'; '.join(succession_phrases[:2])}") all_key_phrases.update(succession_phrases) print(f"Text preview: {text_to_analyze[:250]}...") print("-" * 50) # Save comprehensive results to workspace results_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Web scraping with requests and BeautifulSoup (Bing search) - Fixed version', 'search_objective': 'Identify Party Secretaries of Yangjiang Province who later became Mayor of Zhongshan', 'search_terms': search_terms, 'total_searches_conducted': len(search_terms), 'total_results': len(all_search_results), 'result_categorization': { 'perfect_matches': len(perfect_match), 'high_relevance_count': len(high_relevance), 'medium_relevance_count': len(medium_relevance), 'both_cities_count': len(both_cities), 'succession_indicators_count': len(with_succession) }, 'extracted_intelligence': { 'potential_names': list(all_potential_names), 'potential_years': list(all_potential_years), 'political_terms': list(all_political_terms), 'key_phrases': list(all_key_phrases) }, 'all_results': all_search_results, 'perfect_matches': perfect_match, 'high_relevance_results': high_relevance, 'both_cities_results': both_cities, 'succession_results': with_succession } results_file = 'workspace/yangjiang_zhongshan_political_succession_comprehensive.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(results_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH CAMPAIGN SUMMARY:") print(f"{'='*60}") print(f"Search method: Web scraping (Bing search engine) - FIXED") print(f"Total search terms executed: {len(search_terms)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_search_results)}") print(f"Perfect matches (all 3 criteria): {len(perfect_match)}") print(f"High relevance results (‚â•2 criteria): {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results with succession indicators: {len(with_succession)}") print(f"Comprehensive results saved to: {results_file}") # Display extracted intelligence summary if all_potential_names: print(f"\nüë• EXTRACTED POTENTIAL OFFICIAL NAMES: {', '.join(sorted(all_potential_names))}") if all_potential_years: print(f"üìÖ EXTRACTED POTENTIAL APPOINTMENT YEARS: {', '.join(sorted(all_potential_years))}") if all_political_terms: print(f"üèõÔ∏è POLITICAL TERMS IDENTIFIED: {', '.join(sorted(all_political_terms))}") print(f"\nüèÅ COMPREHENSIVE WEB SCRAPING SEARCH COMPLETE!") print(f"Status: Successfully executed all {len(search_terms)} search strategies") print(f"Next step: Analyze the {len(all_search_results)} collected results to identify specific succession patterns") print(f"Focus: Look for officials who moved from Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor positions") if len(all_search_results) == 0: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: No search results obtained. This could indicate:") print(f" 1. Network connectivity issues") print(f" 2. Search engine blocking/rate limiting") print(f" 3. Need for alternative search approaches") print(f" 4. Very specific/rare political succession pattern") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Collected {len(all_search_results)} results for analysis") print(f" Ready for detailed examination of political succession patterns")

Python Code python
# Simple and direct approach to search for Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession # Avoiding complex scoping issues by defining everything inline import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import urllib.parse import time print("Direct web scraping approach for Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession") print("Focus: Chinese political appointments and succession patterns") print("=" * 100) # Simple function with headers defined inside to avoid scoping issues def simple_search(query): # Headers defined inside function to avoid scoping issues request_headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } results = [] print(f"\nSearching for: {query}") try: # Try DuckDuckGo first (often more accessible) ddg_url = f"https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" print(f"DuckDuckGo URL: {ddg_url}") response = requests.get(ddg_url, headers=request_headers, timeout=10) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Find DuckDuckGo result elements search_results = soup.find_all('div', class_='result') if not search_results: search_results = soup.find_all('div', {'class': lambda x: x and 'result' in x.lower()}) print(f"Found {len(search_results)} DuckDuckGo results") for i, result in enumerate(search_results[:5]): try: # Extract title title_elem = result.find('a', class_='result__a') or result.find('h2') or result.find('a') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link = title_elem.get('href', 'No link') if title_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet snippet_elem = result.find('a', class_='result__snippet') or result.find('div') or result.find('span') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f"\nResult {i+1}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Simple relevance check combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" has_yangjiang = any(term in combined_text for term in ['yangjiang', 'Èò≥Ê±ü']) has_zhongshan = any(term in combined_text for term in ['zhongshan', '‰∏≠Â±±']) has_political = any(term in combined_text for term in ['secretary', '‰π¶ËÆ∞', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'appointment', '‰ªªÂëΩ']) relevance = sum([has_yangjiang, has_zhongshan, has_political]) if has_yangjiang: print("‚úì Yangjiang mentioned") if has_zhongshan: print("‚úì Zhongshan mentioned") if has_political: print("‚úì Political terms found") if relevance >= 2: print(f"üéØ RELEVANT (Score: {relevance}/3)") elif relevance >= 1: print(f"‚≠ê SOMEWHAT RELEVANT (Score: {relevance}/3)") results.append({ 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance, 'has_yangjiang': has_yangjiang, 'has_zhongshan': has_zhongshan, 'has_political': has_political }) print("-" * 40) except Exception as e: print(f"Error processing result {i+1}: {str(e)}") continue # If DuckDuckGo fails, try a simple Bing approach if not results: print("\nTrying Bing search as fallback...") bing_url = f"https://www.bing.com/search?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" try: response = requests.get(bing_url, headers=request_headers, timeout=10) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') bing_results = soup.find_all('li', class_='b_algo')[:3] print(f"Found {len(bing_results)} Bing results") for i, result in enumerate(bing_results): try: title_elem = result.find('h2') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' link_elem = title_elem.find('a') if title_elem else None link = link_elem.get('href', 'No link') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet_elem = result.find('p') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f"\nBing Result {i+1}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") results.append({ 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'source': 'Bing' }) except Exception as e: print(f"Error processing Bing result: {str(e)}") continue except Exception as e: print(f"Bing search also failed: {str(e)}") except Exception as e: print(f"Search failed: {str(e)}") print(f"\nCompleted search for '{query}': {len(results)} results") return results # Define key search terms search_queries = [ 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor', 'Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÂÆòÂëòË∞ÉÂä®', # Yangjiang Zhongshan official transfers 'Guangdong Province Yangjiang Zhongshan political appointments', 'Âπø‰∏úÁúÅ Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÊîøÊ≤ª‰ªªÂëΩ' # Guangdong Province Yangjiang Zhongshan political appointments ] all_results = [] print(f"\nExecuting {len(search_queries)} search strategies...") print("=" * 80) # Execute searches for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\n{'='*80}") print(f"SEARCH {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}") print(f"{'='*80}") search_results = simple_search(query) all_results.extend(search_results) print(f"\nSearch {i} completed: {len(search_results)} results") print(f"Total results so far: {len(all_results)}") # Add delay between searches if i < len(search_queries): print("Waiting 3 seconds...") time.sleep(3) # Analyze all results print(f"\n\n{'='*80}") print("COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS") print(f"{'='*80}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") # Filter for most relevant results high_relevance = [r for r in all_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 2] medium_relevance = [r for r in all_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) == 1] both_cities = [r for r in all_results if r.get('has_yangjiang', False) and r.get('has_zhongshan', False)] print(f"High relevance results: {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Medium relevance results: {len(medium_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") # Display most relevant findings if high_relevance: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS:") print(f"{'='*50}") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f"\n[{i}] {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}/3") print("-" * 50) if both_cities: print(f"\nüèõÔ∏è RESULTS MENTIONING BOTH CITIES:") print(f"{'='*50}") for i, result in enumerate(both_cities, 1): print(f"\n[{i}] {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print("-" * 50) # Extract potential names and information print(f"\n\nüîç INFORMATION EXTRACTION:") print(f"{'='*50}") import re all_names = set() all_years = set() for result in all_results: text = f"{result['title']} {result['snippet']}" # Look for Chinese names (2-4 characters) chinese_names = re.findall(r'[\u4e00-\u9fff]{2,4}', text) # Filter out place names filtered_names = [name for name in chinese_names if name not in ['Èò≥Ê±ü', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'Âπø‰∏ú', 'Â∏ÇÂßî', 'ÊîøÂ∫ú', '‰∫∫Ê∞ë']] all_names.update(filtered_names) # Look for years years = re.findall(r'(19|20)\d{2}', text) all_years.update(years) if all_names: print(f"Potential names found: {', '.join(sorted(list(all_names)))[:200]}...") if all_years: print(f"Potential years found: {', '.join(sorted(list(all_years)))}") # Save results final_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Simple web scraping with inline headers', 'objective': 'Find Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession', 'total_searches': len(search_queries), 'total_results': len(all_results), 'high_relevance_count': len(high_relevance), 'both_cities_count': len(both_cities), 'extracted_names': list(all_names), 'extracted_years': list(all_years), 'all_results': all_results, 'high_relevance_results': high_relevance, 'both_cities_results': both_cities } results_file = 'workspace/yangjiang_zhongshan_simple_search.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä FINAL SUMMARY:") print(f"{'='*40}") print(f"Search approach: Simple web scraping (fixed headers)") print(f"Total searches executed: {len(search_queries)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") print(f"High relevance results: {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if len(all_results) > 0: print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Collected {len(all_results)} results for analysis") print(f"Ready to examine for Yangjiang Party Secretary ‚Üí Zhongshan Mayor succession patterns") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No results obtained - may need alternative search strategies") print(f"Possible issues: Network connectivity, search engine blocking, or very rare succession pattern") print(f"\nüèÅ SEARCH COMPLETE!")
Execution Output
Code Output: Direct web scraping approach for Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession Focus: Chinese political appointments and succession patterns ==================================================================================================== Executing 5 search strategies... ================================================================================ ================================================================================ SEARCH 1/5: Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø ================================================================================ Searching for: Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø DuckDuckGo URL: https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q=%E9%98%B3%E6%B1%9F%E5%B8%82%E5%A7%94%E4%B9%A6%E8%AE%B0%20%E4%B8%AD%E5%B1%B1%E5%B8%82%E9%95%BF Response status: 202 Trying Bing search as fallback... Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code crashed with 'NameError: name headers is not defined' during all search attempts, despite the developer's attempts to fix the scoping issue. The error persisted across all search strategies, resulting in 0 results collected from 5 completed searches before the process stopped. The output also shows contamination from unrelated tasks (Edith Garrud, Sylvia Pankhurst research), indicating execution environment issues. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no political succession information obtained due to the persistent variable scope error preventing any web scraping from executing. The comprehensive search strategy with 8 different Chinese/English terms is well-designed, but the technical implementation has a critical flaw. Recommended fix: Define the headers dictionary directly inside the search_web() function to completely eliminate scoping issues, or use a simpler approach without external variable dependencies. The code structure shows good planning but needs a fundamental fix to the headers accessibility problem before it can execute the intended searches for Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession patterns.
Python Code python
# Simple and direct approach to search for Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession # Avoiding complex scoping issues by defining everything inline import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import urllib.parse import time print("Direct web scraping approach for Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession") print("Focus: Chinese political appointments and succession patterns") print("=" * 100) # Simple function with headers defined inside to avoid scoping issues def simple_search(query): # Headers defined inside function to avoid scoping issues request_headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } results = [] print(f"\nSearching for: {query}") try: # Try DuckDuckGo first (often more accessible) ddg_url = f"https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" print(f"DuckDuckGo URL: {ddg_url}") response = requests.get(ddg_url, headers=request_headers, timeout=10) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Find DuckDuckGo result elements search_results = soup.find_all('div', class_='result') if not search_results: search_results = soup.find_all('div', {'class': lambda x: x and 'result' in x.lower()}) print(f"Found {len(search_results)} DuckDuckGo results") for i, result in enumerate(search_results[:5]): try: # Extract title title_elem = result.find('a', class_='result__a') or result.find('h2') or result.find('a') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link = title_elem.get('href', 'No link') if title_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet snippet_elem = result.find('a', class_='result__snippet') or result.find('div') or result.find('span') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f"\nResult {i+1}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Simple relevance check combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" has_yangjiang = any(term in combined_text for term in ['yangjiang', 'Èò≥Ê±ü']) has_zhongshan = any(term in combined_text for term in ['zhongshan', '‰∏≠Â±±']) has_political = any(term in combined_text for term in ['secretary', '‰π¶ËÆ∞', 'mayor', 'Â∏ÇÈïø', 'appointment', '‰ªªÂëΩ']) relevance = sum([has_yangjiang, has_zhongshan, has_political]) if has_yangjiang: print("‚úì Yangjiang mentioned") if has_zhongshan: print("‚úì Zhongshan mentioned") if has_political: print("‚úì Political terms found") if relevance >= 2: print(f"üéØ RELEVANT (Score: {relevance}/3)") elif relevance >= 1: print(f"‚≠ê SOMEWHAT RELEVANT (Score: {relevance}/3)") results.append({ 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance, 'has_yangjiang': has_yangjiang, 'has_zhongshan': has_zhongshan, 'has_political': has_political }) print("-" * 40) except Exception as e: print(f"Error processing result {i+1}: {str(e)}") continue # If DuckDuckGo fails, try a simple Bing approach if not results: print("\nTrying Bing search as fallback...") bing_url = f"https://www.bing.com/search?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" try: response = requests.get(bing_url, headers=request_headers, timeout=10) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') bing_results = soup.find_all('li', class_='b_algo')[:3] print(f"Found {len(bing_results)} Bing results") for i, result in enumerate(bing_results): try: title_elem = result.find('h2') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' link_elem = title_elem.find('a') if title_elem else None link = link_elem.get('href', 'No link') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet_elem = result.find('p') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f"\nBing Result {i+1}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f"Snippet: {snippet}") results.append({ 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'source': 'Bing' }) except Exception as e: print(f"Error processing Bing result: {str(e)}") continue except Exception as e: print(f"Bing search also failed: {str(e)}") except Exception as e: print(f"Search failed: {str(e)}") print(f"\nCompleted search for '{query}': {len(results)} results") return results # Define key search terms search_queries = [ 'Èò≥Ê±üÂ∏ÇÂßî‰π¶ËÆ∞ ‰∏≠Â±±Â∏ÇÈïø', # Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor 'Yangjiang Party Secretary Zhongshan Mayor', 'Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÂÆòÂëòË∞ÉÂä®', # Yangjiang Zhongshan official transfers 'Guangdong Province Yangjiang Zhongshan political appointments', 'Âπø‰∏úÁúÅ Èò≥Ê±ü ‰∏≠Â±± ÊîøÊ≤ª‰ªªÂëΩ' # Guangdong Province Yangjiang Zhongshan political appointments ] all_results = [] print(f"\nExecuting {len(search_queries)} search strategies...") print("=" * 80) # Execute searches for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\n{'='*80}") print(f"SEARCH {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}") print(f"{'='*80}") search_results = simple_search(query) all_results.extend(search_results) print(f"\nSearch {i} completed: {len(search_results)} results") print(f"Total results so far: {len(all_results)}") # Add delay between searches if i < len(search_queries): print("Waiting 3 seconds...") time.sleep(3) # Analyze all results print(f"\n\n{'='*80}") print("COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS") print(f"{'='*80}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") # Filter for most relevant results high_relevance = [r for r in all_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 2] medium_relevance = [r for r in all_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) == 1] both_cities = [r for r in all_results if r.get('has_yangjiang', False) and r.get('has_zhongshan', False)] print(f"High relevance results: {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Medium relevance results: {len(medium_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") # Display most relevant findings if high_relevance: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS:") print(f"{'='*50}") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f"\n[{i}] {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"Link: {result['link']}") print(f"Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}/3") print("-" * 50) if both_cities: print(f"\nüèõÔ∏è RESULTS MENTIONING BOTH CITIES:") print(f"{'='*50}") for i, result in enumerate(both_cities, 1): print(f"\n[{i}] {result['title']}") print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print("-" * 50) # Extract potential names and information print(f"\n\nüîç INFORMATION EXTRACTION:") print(f"{'='*50}") import re all_names = set() all_years = set() for result in all_results: text = f"{result['title']} {result['snippet']}" # Look for Chinese names (2-4 characters) chinese_names = re.findall(r'[\u4e00-\u9fff]{2,4}', text) # Filter out place names filtered_names = [name for name in chinese_names if name not in ['Èò≥Ê±ü', '‰∏≠Â±±', 'Âπø‰∏ú', 'Â∏ÇÂßî', 'ÊîøÂ∫ú', '‰∫∫Ê∞ë']] all_names.update(filtered_names) # Look for years years = re.findall(r'(19|20)\d{2}', text) all_years.update(years) if all_names: print(f"Potential names found: {', '.join(sorted(list(all_names)))[:200]}...") if all_years: print(f"Potential years found: {', '.join(sorted(list(all_years)))}") # Save results final_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Simple web scraping with inline headers', 'objective': 'Find Yangjiang Party Secretary to Zhongshan Mayor succession', 'total_searches': len(search_queries), 'total_results': len(all_results), 'high_relevance_count': len(high_relevance), 'both_cities_count': len(both_cities), 'extracted_names': list(all_names), 'extracted_years': list(all_years), 'all_results': all_results, 'high_relevance_results': high_relevance, 'both_cities_results': both_cities } results_file = 'workspace/yangjiang_zhongshan_simple_search.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä FINAL SUMMARY:") print(f"{'='*40}") print(f"Search approach: Simple web scraping (fixed headers)") print(f"Total searches executed: {len(search_queries)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") print(f"High relevance results: {len(high_relevance)}") print(f"Results mentioning both cities: {len(both_cities)}") print(f"Results saved to: {results_file}") if len(all_results) > 0: print(f"\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Collected {len(all_results)} results for analysis") print(f"Ready to examine for Yangjiang Party Secretary ‚Üí Zhongshan Mayor succession patterns") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No results obtained - may need alternative search strategies") print(f"Possible issues: Network connectivity, search engine blocking, or very rare succession pattern") print(f"\nüèÅ SEARCH COMPLETE!")
